name: Dinner Tonight: Spring Minestrone with Brown Basmati Rice
description: Spring vegetables are beginning to appear in the produce aisle—asparagus, sugar snap peas—so I wanted to take advantage. What I found is one of those absurdly simple recipes that you think just won't work. Or at least, that's what I...
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup medium-grain brown basmati rice, rinsed
1 cup sugar snap or snow peas, or a combination of them, trimmed and cut in half diagonally
8 spears asparagus, trimmed and diagonally sliced into 1-inch pieces
1/2 cup green peas, fresh or frozen (not canned)
Fine-grain sea salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: In a large saucepan or dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat, then add the sliced shallots and garlic and sauté until soft but not browned. Add the rice and toast for a minute or so, then add the stock and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat until the rice is just tender, 35-45 minutes.
Add the vegetables to the soup and simmer for 2-3 minutes, until cooked but still barely crunchy. Serve immediately while the vegetables are still crisp.
